Question
========

Given is the following formula of the between-group variance in a one-way ANOVA, where *g* represents the number of groups and *i* represents group *i*:

$s_{\overline{y}}^{2} = \frac{\sum{n_{i}(\overline{y}_{i}-\overline{y})^2}}{g-1}$

What is in the numerator and denominator?

Numerator: ...; denominator: ... .

  
Answerlist
----------
* Quadrat sum ; degrees of freedom
* Degrees of freedom ; quadrat sum
* Residuals ; degrees of freedom
* Degrees of freedom ; residuals

Solution
========

Answerlist

* Correct
* Incorrect
* Incorrect
* Incorrect
